item.description:
All Greater Boston Humanists, Atheists, Free-Thinkers, Non-Theists, Skeptics, and other varieties of freethinker are invited to the Greater Boston Humanists annual SUMMER PICNIC.

Hosted this year at the home of the Barbara & Joe Gerstein. All are welcome to join us for this buffet and barbecue, followed by a brief talk titled "Humanism in the Antipodes: Why and How Australia and New Zealand Elect Atheist/Agnostic Prime Ministers While Any Hint By A US Politician Of Christian Non-Orthodoxy Invites A Trip To The Political Graveyard."

Bring a hearty appetite! If you'd like to contribute to the potluck, call Tom Ferrick at 617-547-1497 and let him know whether you would like to bring an appetizer, salad, dessert or drink. Beer and Soft Drinks will be provided as will a variety Of grilled meat entrees, plus vegetarian and vegan entrees. Various types of game equipment will also be available.

Various people have volunteered to do ride-sharing; if you don't have access to a car, leave a comment below so we can try to arrange a ride with pickup from the Riverside MBTA Station or Kendall Green Commuter Rail stop in Weston.

Parking is somewhat limited immediately outside the home; please leave spaces close to the condo for the elderly or infirm. The able-bodied are asked to drop off any passengers and gear, and then park in the Curling Club parking lot adjacent.

In case of meteorological inclemency, a decision as to postpone to Sunday will be made not later than 10 AM Saturday. There is adequate internal space, so the picnic will take place on Saturday, in case of rain on Saturday and a prediction of rain on the Sunday. Call 617-547-1497 for a weather update if in doubt, or 508-310-5093.

Directions: From the East, and South: Take 128/95 towards the Weston Exit or Route 30 or Mass. Turnpike West. Take Route 30 West. From the Weston Exit, you will see Mainstone Rd. heading to the right, just after entering Natick (about 5 miles). Turn right on Mainstone Rd. and continue to the "T" intersection at about 1 mile. Turn right on Rice Rd. 200 yards on left (at 138 Rice rd.), turn into Curling Lane. Immediate left into Hayfield Lane. Continue to 410. If you miss the Mainstone Rd. turn, don't U-turn. Continue 1/2 mile to traffic light and turn right on Rice Rd. Approx. 1.5 miles to Curling Lane on left.

From the North: 128/95 South to Route 20 West Exit. Continue about 4.5 miles. Just after entering Wayland and just before the Coach Grill, bear left at a fork onto Old Connecticut Path. Follow about a mile and turn left on Rice Road. Pass the farm with the gorgeous White-Banded Galloway cattle. At about 1 mile, turn right on Curling Lane (at 138 Rice Rd.), immediate left is Hayfield Lane. Continue to 410.

From the West: Take Route 30 Exit from the Mass. Turnpike in Natick. Take Route 30 East. At about 4 miles, turn left at traffic light onto Rice Rd. (Don't be fooled by the same road on the right, which is Oak St.). Continue down Rice Rd. about 1.5 miles. Turn left on Curling Lane (at 138 Rice Rd.) then immediate left into Hayfield Lane. Continue to 410. You have arrived at your destination. If you are lost, call 339 927-1020 for directions.
item.name: Greater Boston Humanists Annual Summer Picnic
